text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The response details a 'Substance-First' IP Migration Model focusing on building genuine Irish substance (employees, development) and using transfer pricing mechanisms (part-sale/license) to shift profit. While this structure inherently deals with the risk of HMRC challenging the Irish entity's activities, it never explicitly mentions the term 'Permanent Establishment (PE) risk' or discusses the specific PE implications for the Irish company under UK/Irish tax treaties or general international tax principles, which is the core requirement of the criterion.", "criterion_id": "ccb7418d-0811-4331-9661-bbd99c3c9c6a"}
